intro: Dufrenoya sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globe-fruit, is a rare and unusual plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its spherical, fleshy fruits that resemble small, green balls, which turn red when mature. The plant produces small, white flowers and has a woody stem with a distinctive, branching pattern. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
